revised_title: Fluid Refracting Telescopes and Their Advantages
tldr: In this paper, Peter Barlow discusses the performance of fluid refracting telescopes and their potential for resolving double stars, nebulae, and displaying detailed planetary images. He explains the advantages of using sulfur carbide as a lens material, which allows for a more compact telescope design and improved performance. Barlow believes that with proper assistance, he can create a telescope with a two-foot aperture and 24 feet in length, surpassing the capabilities of current telescopes.
